children.text: There are holes and divots in the top of the concrete slab where floor coverings are to be installed.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 2.11 Finish to Concrete Slabs, states
‘The finish to a concrete slab is defective if it is not suitable for the documented applied finishes such as tiles, polished concrete, carpet or sheet flooring, including set downs where required’ .
These areas must be properly filled to flush with the surrounding surfaces to avoid future low spots in the floor coverings.
